intro: Catabrosella humilis subsp. calvertii, commonly known as the Calvert's catabrosella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and produces vibrant pink or red flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
